intro: Dimocarpus, commonly known as longan, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Sapindaceae. It consists of several species, with Dimocarpus longan being the most well-known and widely cultivated. The plant is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its evergreen tree structure and fragrant flowers. Its fruit, which is typically hairy and reddish when ripe, contains a single seed surrounded by a juicy, sweet pulp. The botanical features of Dimocarpus make it an important species in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
